channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SQLdepth: Generalizable Self-Supervised Fine-Structured Monocular Depth Estimation
item.description: Each individual slice of the volume signifies the relative distances between points and objects within a latent space.

item.title: Patent image retrieval using transformer-based deep metric learning
item.description: Intellectual property work covers a wide range of areas.

item.title: OpenIns3D: Snap and Lookup for 3D Open-vocabulary Instance Segmentation
item.description: The "Snap" module generates synthetic scene-level images at multiple scales and leverages 2D vision language models to extract interesting objects.

item.title: Fusing Monocular Images and Sparse IMU Signals for Real-time Human Motion Capture
item.description: We believe that the combination is complementary and able to solve the inherent difficulties of using one modality input, including occlusions, extreme lighting/texture, and out-of-view for visual mocap and global drifts for inertial mocap.

item.title: A Theoretical and Practical Framework for Evaluating Uncertainty Calibration in Object Detection
item.description: The proliferation of Deep Neural Networks has resulted in machine learning systems becoming increasingly more present in various real-world applications.

item.title: A Text-based Approach For Link Prediction on Wikipedia Articles
item.description: This paper present our work in the DSAA 2023 Challenge about Link Prediction for Wikipedia Articles.

item.title: Explainable Active Learning for Preference Elicitation
item.description: We implement the proposed preference elicitation methodology for food recommendation.

item.title: Multiple transformation function estimation for image enhancement
item.description: First, we develop a histogram-based multiple transformation function estimation network (HMTF-Net) to estimate multiple transformation functions by exploiting both the spatial and statistical information of the input images.

item.title: DiffuGen: Adaptable Approach for Generating Labeled Image Datasets using Stable Diffusion Models
item.description: Generating high-quality labeled image datasets is crucial for training accurate and robust machine learning models in the field of computer vision.

item.title: Human-Inspired Facial Sketch Synthesis with Dynamic Adaptation
item.description: Besides, different artists may use diverse drawing techniques and create multiple styles of sketches; but the style is globally consistent in a sketch.

item.title: SparseSat-NeRF: Dense Depth Supervised Neural Radiance Fields for Sparse Satellite Images
item.description: However, NeRF and its variants require many views to produce convincing scene's geometries which in earth observation satellite imaging is rare.

item.title: Discrete Morphological Neural Networks
item.description: A DMNN architecture, which is represented by a Morphological Computational Graph, is designed as in the classical heuristic design of morphological operators, in which the designer should combine a set of MM operators and Boolean operations based on prior information and theoretical knowledge.

item.title: NeuroSurgeon: A Toolkit for Subnetwork Analysis
item.description: Despite recent advances in the field of explainability, much remains unknown about the algorithms that neural networks learn to represent.

item.title: Publicly Shareable Clinical Large Language Model Built on Synthetic Clinical Notes
item.description: The development of large language models tailored for handling patients' clinical notes is often hindered by the limited accessibility and usability of these notes due to strict privacy regulations.

item.title: A Locality-based Neural Solver for Optical Motion Capture
item.description: Finally, we propose a training regime based on representation learning and data augmentation, by training the model on data with masking.

item.title: FederatedScope-LLM: A Comprehensive Package for Fine-tuning Large Language Models in Federated Learning
item.description: When several entities have similar interested tasks, but their data cannot be shared because of privacy concerns regulations, federated learning (FL) is a mainstream solution to leverage the data of different entities.

item.title: NeMig -- A Bilingual News Collection and Knowledge Graph about Migration
item.description: News recommendation plays a critical role in shaping the public's worldviews through the way in which it filters and disseminates information about different topics.

item.title: Multi-fidelity reduced-order surrogate modeling
item.description: High-fidelity numerical simulations of partial differential equations (PDEs) given a restricted computational budget can significantly limit the number of parameter configurations considered and/or time window evaluated for modeling a given system.

item.title: JoTR: A Joint Transformer and Reinforcement Learning Framework for Dialog Policy Learning
item.description: In addition, JoTR employs reinforcement learning with a reward-shaping mechanism to efficiently finetune the word-level dialogue policy, which allows the model to learn from its interactions, improving its performance over time.

item.title: Copiloting the Copilots: Fusing Large Language Models with Completion Engines for Automated Program Repair
item.description: Therefore, we propose Repilot, a framework to further copilot the AI "copilots" (i. e., LLMs) by synthesizing more valid patches during the repair process.

item.title: Interpretation of High-Dimensional Linear Regression: Effects of Nullspace and Regularization Demonstrated on Battery Data
item.description: We developed an optimization formulation to compare regression coefficients and coefficients obtained by physical engineering knowledge to understand which part of the coefficient differences are close to the nullspace.

item.title: Mechanism of feature learning in convolutional neural networks
item.description: We then demonstrate the generality of our result by using the patch-based AGOP to enable deep feature learning in convolutional kernel machines.

item.title: General and Practical Tuning Method for Off-the-Shelf Graph-Based Index: SISAP Indexing Challenge Report by Team UTokyo
item.description: Despite the efficacy of graph-based algorithms for Approximate Nearest Neighbor (ANN) searches, the optimal tuning of such systems remains unclear.

item.title: Learning-based NLOS Detection and Uncertainty Prediction of GNSS Observations with Transformer-Enhanced LSTM Network
item.description: This work proposes a Deep-Learning-based method to detect NLOS receptions and predict GNSS pseudorange errors by analyzing GNSS observations as a spatio-temporal modeling problem.

item.title: Point-Bind & Point-LLM: Aligning Point Cloud with Multi-modality for 3D Understanding, Generation, and Instruction Following
item.description: We introduce Point-Bind, a 3D multi-modality model aligning point clouds with 2D image, language, audio, and video.

item.title: Declarative Reasoning on Explanations Using Constraint Logic Programming
item.description: Explaining opaque Machine Learning (ML) models is an increasingly relevant problem.

item.title: Can Programming Languages Boost Each Other via Instruction Tuning?
item.description: Results demonstrate that programming languages can significantly improve each other.

item.title: Latent Variable Multi-output Gaussian Processes for Hierarchical Datasets
item.description: Multi-output Gaussian processes (MOGPs) have been introduced to deal with multiple tasks by exploiting the correlations between different outputs.

item.title: The Gender-GAP Pipeline: A Gender-Aware Polyglot Pipeline for Gender Characterisation in 55 Languages
item.description: We showcase it to report gender representation in WMT training data and development data for the News task, confirming that current data is skewed towards masculine representation.

item.title: Link Prediction for Wikipedia Articles as a Natural Language Inference Task
item.description: Drawing inspiration from recent advancements in natural language processing and understanding, we cast link prediction as an NLI task, wherein the presence of a link between two articles is treated as a premise, and the task is to determine whether this premise holds based on the information presented in the articles.

item.title: Efficacy of Neural Prediction-Based NAS for Zero-Shot NAS Paradigm
item.description: In contrast, handcrafted performance indicators (zero-shot NAS), which use the same architecture with random initialization, can generalize across multiple search spaces.

item.title: Curvature-based Pooling within Graph Neural Networks
item.description: CurvPool exploits the notion of curvature of a graph to adaptively identify structures responsible for both over-smoothing and over-squashing.

item.title: PointOcc: Cylindrical Tri-Perspective View for Point-based 3D Semantic Occupancy Prediction
item.description: To address this, we propose a cylindrical tri-perspective view to represent point clouds effectively and comprehensively and a PointOcc model to process them efficiently.

item.title: BenchTemp: A General Benchmark for Evaluating Temporal Graph Neural Networks
item.description: To handle graphs in which features or connectivities are evolving over time, a series of temporal graph neural networks (TGNNs) have been proposed.

item.title: PointLLM: Empowering Large Language Models to Understand Point Clouds
item.description: The unprecedented advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs) have created a profound impact on natural language processing but are yet to fully embrace the realm of 3D understanding.

item.title: BioCoder: A Benchmark for Bioinformatics Code Generation with Contextual Pragmatic Knowledge
item.description: BioCoder incorporates a fuzz-testing framework for evaluation, and we have applied it to evaluate many models including InCoder, CodeGen, CodeGen2, SantaCoder, StarCoder, StarCoder+, InstructCodeT5+, and ChatGPT.

item.title: Simple LLM Prompting is State-of-the-Art for Robust and Multilingual Dialogue Evaluation
item.description: Despite significant research effort in the development of automatic dialogue evaluation metrics, little thought is given to evaluating dialogues other than in English.

item.title: MoMA: Momentum Contrastive Learning with Multi-head Attention-based Knowledge Distillation for Histopathology Image Analysis
item.description: Specifically, we employ a student-teacher framework to learn a target model from a pre-trained, teacher model without direct access to source data and distill relevant knowledge via momentum contrastive learning with multi-head attention mechanism, which provides consistent and context-aware feature representations.

item.title: Generate Your Own Scotland: Satellite Image Generation Conditioned on Maps
item.description: Despite recent advancements in image generation, diffusion models still remain largely underexplored in Earth Observation.

item.title: ScrollNet: Dynamic Weight Importance for Continual Learning
item.description: The importance of weights for each task can be determined either explicitly through learning a task-specific mask during training (e. g., parameter isolation-based approaches) or implicitly by introducing a regularization term (e. g., regularization-based approaches).

item.title: Towards Optimal Patch Size in Vision Transformers for Tumor Segmentation
item.description: Although transformers can capture long-range features, their segmentation performance decreases with various tumor sizes due to the model sensitivity to the input patch size.

item.title: Illumination Distillation Framework for Nighttime Person Re-Identification and A New Benchmark
item.description: The illumination enhancement branch first estimates an enhanced image from the nighttime image using a nonlinear curve mapping method and then extracts the enhanced features.

item.title: Improving Lens Flare Removal with General Purpose Pipeline and Multiple Light Sources Recovery
item.description: In this paper, we propose a solution to improve the performance of lens flare removal by revisiting the ISP and remodeling the principle of automatic exposure in the synthesis pipeline and design a more reliable light sources recovery strategy.

item.title: Neural Gradient Regularizer
item.description: NGR is applicable to various image types and different image processing tasks, functioning in a zero-shot learning fashion, making it a versatile and plug-and-play regularizer.

item.title: 3D-STMN: Dependency-Driven Superpoint-Text Matching Network for End-to-End 3D Referring Expression Segmentation
item.description: In 3D Referring Expression Segmentation (3D-RES), the earlier approach adopts a two-stage paradigm, extracting segmentation proposals and then matching them with referring expressions.

item.title: Unsupervised CT Metal Artifact Reduction by Plugging Diffusion Priors in Dual Domains
item.description: In this paper, we propose an unsupervised MAR method based on the diffusion model, a generative model with a high capacity to represent data distributions.

item.title: SpeechTokenizer: Unified Speech Tokenizer for Speech Large Language Models
item.description: Therefore, we propose SpeechTokenizer, a unified speech tokenizer for speech large language models.

item.title: StyleInV: A Temporal Style Modulated Inversion Network for Unconditional Video Generation
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel motion generator design that uses a learning-based inversion network for GAN.

item.title: Interpreting Sentiment Composition with Latent Semantic Tree
item.description: As the key to sentiment analysis, sentiment composition considers the classification of a constituent via classifications of its contained sub-constituents and rules operated on them.

item.title: Self-pruning Graph Neural Network for Predicting Inflammatory Disease Activity in Multiple Sclerosis from Brain MR Images
item.description: We propose a two-stage MS inflammatory disease activity prediction approach.
